--- "haefeleuser" <haefeleuser@...> wrote:
> I need to compare two object g=
raphs for my JUnit test.
> Example: A -> B -> C
> Each class has a couple o=
f attributes.
> A contains B which contains C.
> I have two instances of A:=
 a1 and a2.
> [...]
> Now I expect that only a certain attribute is differe=
nt
> between a1 and a2. I don't want to retest all the
> attributes. So I w=
ant to test just the difference
> between a1 and a2 object graph.

I might =
just change the attribute in 'a1' that I expect to the value 
I expect in '=
a2', and then compare them for equality.

IE:
  a1 =3D someProcess(parm1);
=
  a2 =3D someProcess(parm2);
  a1.setAttr(2.5);  // the one difference we e=
xpect
  assertEquals(a1, a2);

If the object's '.equals' method isn't suffi=
cient, you may have to 
write a recursive reflection based comparison opera=
tor.  (I'll leave 
that as an exercise to the student.  ;-)
